data.title: MVD Entertainment Group Customer B2B
data.meta_description: The late American extreme punk rock musician, GG Allin, is best remembered for his notorious live performances, which often featured transgressive acts, including self-mutilation, eating his own feces, and attacking the audience. In 1993 he died of an heroin overdose. Aired on Showtime as All In The Family, In director Sami Saif's (Family) upcoming film The Allins we meet the two remaining family members, mother Arleta and brother Merle, who is still active in GG Allins backing band The Murder Junkies. It is the story about an extraordinary loving family, whose departed son and brother has left a trail of unanswered questions, and how we need to feed our own version of the past to overcome the present and the future.
data.text:
The late American extreme punk rock musician, GG Allin, is best remembered for his notorious live performances, which often featured transgressive acts, including self-mutilation, eating his own feces, and attacking the audience. In 1993 he died of an heroin overdose. Aired on Showtime as "All In The Family", In director Sami Saif's (Family) upcoming film The Allins we meet the two remaining family members, mother Arleta and brother Merle, who is still active in GG Allins backing band The Murder Junkies. It is the story about an extraordinary loving family, whose departed son and brother has left a trail of unanswered questions, and how we need to feed our own version of the past to overcome the present and the future.

Media

Watch trailer »

Sales Points

Comp to: Hated: GG Allin and the Murder Junkies, A Band Called Death, The Filth and the Fury, American Hardcore

The film scores an impressive 7.2 (out of 10) on the IMDb!

After debuting exclusively on Showtime, long awaited by fans and the curious is now available on disc for the first time!

Press Quotes

I found it hard not to be touched by how devoted these misfits remain to honoring their fallen son, brother and bandmate.

—weirdestbandintheworld.com

If you're interested in how his infamous legacy has impacted those closest to him and want to know more about the human himself, then this is exactly what you want.

—The VoidReport.com
